about.title: ğŸ‘‹ About Me
description: I'm Joe Jigwan, a senior Computer Engineering student at Kyonggi University and an aspiring IT systems engineer. Through various projects, Iâ€™ve worked on server/DB operations, log analysis, AWS infrastructure setup, and CI/CD automation â€” gaining experience close to real-world service environments.

Through capstone, team, and research projects, I developed skills in operating REST API servers, handling real-time data processing with MongoDB Change Streams, and managing AWS-based deployments, focusing on system stability, operational efficiency, and understanding how services behave in production.
about.strength1: Experience operating RESTful API servers with Spring Boot and managing AWS infrastructure
about.strength2: Data-centric skills including schema design, indexing, and log-based analysis using RDB and MongoDB
about.strength3: Experience working with React + TypeScript SPA (for understanding full service workflow)
about.strength4: Problem-solving experience across diverse environments including YOLO/TACO-based detection and RAG-based car assistant systems

projects.title: ğŸ’¼ Featured Projects
projects.fridge_d_day: An Android native-based food expiration date management app (Physical AI application). I gained experience building an on-device text recognition pipeline using Google ML Kit OCR, implementing local data processing and a background notification system using Room DB and WorkManager, and designing a declarative UI based on Jetpack Compose.
projects.fridge_d_day_link: Go to One Store app page â†’
projects.movie_diary: A sentiment-based movie recommendation service that analyzes user diary entries. In this Reactâ€“Flask architecture, I focused on managing data flow, integrating the AI model environment, and ensuring stable API communication between the frontend and backend.
projects.gildongE: A vehicle assistant backend system built with Spring Boot and MongoDB. I handled the notification-collection schema design, consumable replacement cycle logic, REST API design, and AWS deployment â€” gaining hands-on experience in backend operations, database processing, and cloud-based service management.
projects.build_your_health: A React-based health routine management application. Through this project, I learned how client-side state, data transmission, and UI logic interact within a service workflow.
projects.kakao_clone: A KakaoTalk UI clone built for a Nomad Coders challenge, selected as a distinguished submission. Implemented with HTML/CSS/JavaScript, focusing on responsive UI patterns, DOM rendering behavior, and layout optimization.
projects.dragonball: A PC component price-comparison service â€” practical experience in API structure planning and early-stage data normalization.
projects.dynamic_scraper: A web scraping practice project using BeautifulSoup and Playwright, improving asynchronous processing and website structural analysis.
projects.momentum: A small clone app featuring weather, greetings, and a to-do list â€” helpful for understanding modular UI functionality and client rendering flow.
